result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Michael Rhodes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *AMENDED 12/27/2017 - Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect sentence credit in the amount of eight (8) days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $1,382.10 and restitution surcharge. Restitution will be open for sixty (60) days.
-------------------------------------

Pay court costs.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-------------------------------------

Obtain and maintain full time employment.
-------------------------------------

Not to have any contact with victim, C.L. dob 12/08/02 or her family, her residence or her school. Not to have any contact, other than incidental, with anyone under the age of 18. Not to have any Internet capable devices or be on the Internet without agent consent. Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
-------------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations. 
---------------------------------------

Register as a sex offender and remain in compliance.
---------------------------------------
Defendant shall undergo any and all assessments deemed necessary by agent and is to participate in and complete any recommended treatment.
---------------------------------------
 Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------------------

10 am  Defendant Adam Michael Rhodes in court, in custody with attorney Michelle Marie Dietrich.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel reached an agreement prior to court.  The cell phone contains inappropriate material and therefore cannot be returned.
In addition there is no need to further retain vehicle for evidentiary purposes although a seat cover was removed and that will be retained for appellate purposes.
Vehicle may be released to family minus the seat cover.
Court addresses defendant who indicates he is agreement with statements of Attorney Dietrich.
Attorney Dietrich notes there is $10,000 in bond money still retained by the Clerk of Courts.
Court costs and restitution are less than that amount.  
Court orders that restitution be immediately disbursed to victim if not already done and any balance after financials are paid in full is to be returned to poster.
Attorney Dietrich to submit order.
IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to September 6, 2017.
IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to August 7, 2017.

Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Temporary Commitment form filed

10:08 am  Defendant Adam Michael Rhodes in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:09 am  Both sides have reviewed PSI.  ADA Donohoo notes that there is no victim impact statement but victim's mother wishes to make a statement.
10:10 am  Victim's mother, K.N., makes statement to Court.
10:13 am  ADA Donohoo is appearing on behalf of ADA Johnson who is prosecuting this case.  State has agreement not to make specific recommendation.
10:13 am  Victim's father may arrive late and wish to speak and ADA Donohoo asks Court indulgence if he does appear.
10:14 am  Sentencing argument by Attorney Anderson.  Attorney Anderson advises Court that defendant has been in intensive treatment in State of Illinois.
10:21 am  Defendant's father, Kevin Rhodes, makes statement to Court.
10:23 am  Defendant makes statement to Court.
10:26 am  Court takes brief recess.

10:31 am  Back on the record.  Court is ready to proceed having reviewed PSI, heard argument of Attorney Anderson as well of the statements of victim's mother, defendant's father and the defendant himself.
10:32 am  Court goes over SM-34 factors.
10:43 am  Court pronouces sentence as follows:  9 years in prison divided as 3 years initial confinement followed by 6 years extended supervision.  
Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Pay all court costs including supervision fees.  Register as a sex offender and remain in compliance.   Not to have any contact with victim, C.L. dob 12/08/02 or her family, her residence or her school.   Not to have any contact, other than incidental, with anyone under the age of 18.   Pay restitution in the amount of $1,382.10 and any ongoing amounts.  Restitution will be held open for sixty (60) days.  Complete AODA assessment and follow-through.  Defendant shall undergo any and all assessments deemed necessary by agent and is to participate in and complete any recommended treatment.  Not to have any internet capable devices or be on the internet without agent consent.  Obtain and maintain full-time employment.  Not to possess or consume alcohol.  Not to possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any firearms.  Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for any programming.
Court gives defendant statutory WARNINGS about deportation, voting ineligibility until civil rights restored, firearm possession (Sec. 941.291) and child offender working with children (Sec. 948.13)

Defendant's Motion to Modify Conditions of Release
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.L. dob 12-08-02 OR HER RESIDENCE OR HER FAMILY MATTERS.
